title: How to Fold an Origami Star (Shuriken)

steps.title: Begin with a rectangular piece of paper.
steps.content: Begin with a rectangular piece of paper. Ordinary loose paper or construction paper will do. We will make a square piece of paper from this. If you're already starting with a square piece of origami paper, skip the next two steps. Alternatively, you can find a range of origami paper on Amazon .

steps.title: Fold the diagonal of the square.
steps.content: Fold the diagonal of the square. Fold the top right hand corner diagonally down so the top of the paper lines up with the left side, forming a point at the top right corner.

steps.title: Remove the extra piece.
steps.content: Remove the extra piece. Cut or carefully tear along the edge so you are left with a square of paper.

steps.title: Fold the square in half
steps.content: Fold the square in half . The fold should be parallel to the edges. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the square in half.
steps.content: Cut the square in half. Cut the square in half into 2 equal parts. Scissors may make this easier. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat.
steps.content: Repeat. Fold each piece in half vertically again, parallel to the long sides.

steps.title: Fold the ends.
steps.content: Fold the ends. Fold the end diagonally, so the edges line up. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat.
steps.content: Repeat. Repeat this fold, on each end of each strip, making sure the folds are oriented as shown.

steps.title: Make the triangle fold.
steps.content: Make the triangle fold. Fold the end on the diagonal again. You should end with a big triangle facing you and two smaller triangles facing away from you.

steps.title: Repeat.
steps.content: Repeat. Repeat this same fold on each end of each strip. Make sure the orientations go opposite one another, as shown. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Turn over only the piece on the left and arrange the two parts, as shown.
steps.content: Turn over only the piece on the left and arrange the two parts, as shown. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put the right piece on top of the left piece.
steps.content: Put the right piece on top of the left piece. There should be a square in the center of each piece that lines up, but if you can't find it yet, don't worry. Just line up the middles. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the uppermost point inwards on the diagonal and tuck the point into the pocket.
steps.content: Fold the uppermost point inwards on the diagonal and tuck the point into the pocket.

steps.title: Fold the bottom point upwards on the diagonal and tuck the point into the pocket.
steps.content: Fold the bottom point upwards on the diagonal and tuck the point into the pocket.

steps.title: Fold the right point on the diagonal just as before and tuck it into the pocket.
steps.content: Fold the right point on the diagonal just as before and tuck it into the pocket. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the left and final point on the diagonal and tuck it into the last pocket.
steps.content: Fold the left and final point on the diagonal and tuck it into the last pocket. You may have to coax a little to get it tucked in. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Put some tape in the middle of the tucked in middles (optional).
steps.content: Put some tape in the middle of the tucked in middles (optional). This will keep the ninja star from becoming undone.
